content:
TITLE: Configuring HTTP Test Runner for Handler Unit Testing
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set up the HTTPTestRunner for unit testing HTTP handlers directly. Uses httptest.NewRecorder to capture the handler's response without making actual network requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
import "github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/test"

...
handler := func(wr http.RequestWriter, r *http.Request){...}
runner := test.HTTPTestRunner{
    Do: func(r *http.Request, _ *TestCase) (*http.Response, error) {
		rec := httptest.NewRecorder()
		handler(rec, r)
		return rec.Result(), nil
	},
}
runner.Run(t, testCases...)
...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Tyk Gateway using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Steps to quickly set up Tyk Gateway using Docker Compose. This includes cloning the repository, changing to the project directory, and starting the containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk-gateway-docker
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd tyk-gateway-docker
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker-compose up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Compiling Tyk Gateway from Source
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for cloning the Tyk repository and building the gateway from source code. Requires Go version 1.22 for the master branch. Officially supported on Linux/amd64, Linux/i386, and Linux/arm64 platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk
go build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Custom Upstream Mock in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a custom upstream test server using the httptest package. It shows setting up a test server with custom logic and overriding the API's target URL to use the test server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
 ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
 defer ts.Close()

upstream := httptest.NewServer(http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
        // custom logic
}))

ts.Gw.buildAndLoadAPI(func(spec *APISpec) {
    spec.Proxy.TargetURL = upstream.URL
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Built-in Test Functions for Common Use Cases
DESCRIPTION: Lists the pre-configured test functions exported by the package for common testing scenarios. These helper functions wrap the HTTPTestRunner for testing both HTTP servers and HTTP handlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
func TestHttpServer(t testing.TB, baseURL string, testCases ...TestCase)
func TestHttpHandler(t testing.TB, handle http.HandlerFunc, testCases ...TestCase)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Coprocess Python Auth Plugin in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to test a Python coprocess auth plugin in the Tyk API Gateway. It includes creating a bundle with a manifest and Python script, registering the bundle, and setting up an API spec to use the plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
var pythonBundleWithAuthCheck = map[string]string{
    "manifest.json": `
        {
            "file_list": [
                "middleware.py"
            ],
            "custom_middleware": {
                "driver": "python",
                "auth_check": {
                    "name": "MyAuthHook"
                }
            }
        }
    `,
    "middleware.py": `
from tyk.decorators import *
from gateway import TykGateway as tyk
@Hook
def MyAuthHook(request, session, metadata, spec):
    print("MyAuthHook is called")
    auth_header = request.get_header('Authorization')
    if auth_header == 'valid_token':
        session.rate = 1000.0
        session.per = 1.0
        metadata["token"] = "valid_token"
    return request, session, metadata
    `,
}
    
func TestPython(t *testing.T) {
     ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
     defer ts.Close()
    
    bundleID := ts.registerBundle("python_with_auth_check", pythonBundleWithAuthCheck)

    ts.Gw.buildAndLoadAPI(func(spec *APISpec) {
        spec.UseKeylessAccess = false
        spec.EnableCoProcessAuth = true
        spec.CustomMiddlewareBundle = bundleID
    })
    // test code goes here
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Global Coprocess Settings in Tyk
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows the global configuration for enabling Coprocess in Tyk, including gRPC server settings and bundle downloader options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/grpc/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
"coprocess_options": {
  "enable_coprocess": true,
  "coprocess_grpc_server": "tcp://127.0.0.1:5555"
},
"enable_bundle_downloader": true,
"bundle_base_url": "http://my-bundle-server.com/bundles/",
"public_key_path": "/path/to/my/pubkey"
}
```

TITLE: Configuring API Settings for Coprocess Authentication and Middleware
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates how to configure an API to use Coprocess authentication and middleware, specifying pre-middleware and auth check functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/grpc/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
"enable_coprocess_auth": true,
"custom_middleware": {
  "pre": [
    {
      "name": "MyPreMiddleware",
      "require_session": false
    }
  ],
  "auth_check": {
    "name": "MyAuthCheck"
  },
  "driver": "grpc"
}
}
```

TITLE: Creating User Sessions in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to create a user session in the Tyk API Gateway. It demonstrates creating a session with custom settings and also mentions how to create a session with default settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
 ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
 defer ts.Close()

key := ts.Gw.createSession(func(s *user.SessionState) {
    s.QuotaMax = 2
})
```

TITLE: Creating Go Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up a Go workspace, including the Gateway and plugins folders, and fetching the correct Gateway dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/plugins/go-development-flow.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
go work init ./tyk-release-5.3.6
go work use ./plugins
commit_hash=$(cd tyk-release-5.3.6 && git rev-parse HEAD)
cd plugins && go get github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk@${commit_hash} && go mod tidy && cd -
```

TITLE: Implementing Python Middleware Functions
DESCRIPTION: Sample Python middleware implementation showing pre and post processing hooks using decorators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/python/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from tyk.decorators import *

@Pre
def MyPreMiddleware(request, session, spec):
    print("my_middleware: MyPreMiddleware")
    return request, session

@Post
def MyPreMiddleware(request, session, spec):
    print("my_middleware: MyPreMiddleware")
    return request, session
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mocking RPC (Hybrid) in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to mock the RPC server for testing Hybrid mode in the Tyk API Gateway. It uses the gorpc library to create a dispatcher and mock RPC functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func TestSyncAPISpecsRPCSuccess(t *testing.T) {
    // Mock RPC
    dispatcher := gorpc.NewDispatcher()
    dispatcher.AddFunc("GetApiDefinitions", func(clientAddr string, dr *DefRequest) (string, error) {
        return "[{}]", nil
    })
    dispatcher.AddFunc("Login", func(clientAddr, userKey string) bool {
        return true
    })
    rpc := startRPCMock(dispatcher)
    defer stopRPCMock(rpc)
    count := syncAPISpecs()
    if count != 1 {
        t.Error("Should return array with one spec", apiSpecs)
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Authentication Test using Tyk Test Framework
DESCRIPTION: Test function demonstrating how to use the Tyk test framework to test Basic Authentication scenarios. It sets up a test server, prepares auth sessions, and runs multiple test cases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func TestBasicAuth(t *testing.T) {
	ts := StartTest(nil)
	defer ts.Close()

	session := ts.testPrepareBasicAuth(false)

	validPassword := map[string]string{"Authorization": genAuthHeader("user", "password")}
	wrongPassword := map[string]string{"Authorization": genAuthHeader("user", "wrong")}
	wrongFormat := map[string]string{"Authorization": genAuthHeader("user", "password:more")}
	malformed := map[string]string{"Authorization": "not base64"}

	ts.Run(t, []test.TestCase{
		// Create base auth based key
		{Method: "POST", Path: "/tyk/keys/defaultuser", Data: session, AdminAuth: true, Code: 200},
		{Method: "GET", Path: "/", Code: 401, BodyMatch: `Authorization field missing`},
		{Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: validPassword, Code: 200},
		{Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: wrongPassword, Code: 401},
		{Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: wrongFormat, Code: 400, BodyMatch: `Attempted access with malformed header, values not in basic auth format`},
		{Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: malformed, Code: 400, BodyMatch: `Attempted access with malformed header, auth data not encoded correctly`},
	}...)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Tyk Test Server with Custom Config
DESCRIPTION: Example of initializing a Tyk test server with custom configuration options. This demonstrates how to set up a test environment with specific settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
ts := gateway.StartTest(nil, gateway.TestConfig{
           // Run control API on a separate port
           sepatateControlAPI: true,
           // Add delay after each test case, if you code depend on timing
           // Bad practice, but sometimes needed
           delay: 10 * time.Millisecond,
           // Emulate that Gateway restarted using SIGUSR2
           hotReload: true,
           // Emulate that listener will 
           overrideDefaults, true,
           // if you want to skip the redis cleaning process
           SkipEmptyRedis: false
    })
    defer ts.Close()
```

TITLE: File Naming Pattern for Regression Tests
DESCRIPTION: File naming pattern examples for regression test files, test functions, test data, and utility files. Shows the required format using Jira issue IDs as identifiers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/tests/regression/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
issue_<jira-id>_test.go
Test_Issue<jira-id>
testdata/issue-<jira-id>-<type>.<ext>
regression_test.go
```

TITLE: Loading and Configuring APIs in Tyk Tests
DESCRIPTION: Example of loading and configuring APIs in Tyk tests. This demonstrates how to set up API specifications for testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
defer ts.Close()

ts.Gw.buildAndLoadAPI(func(spec *APISpec) {
    spec.UseBasicAuth = true
    spec.UseKeylessAccess = false
    spec.Proxy.ListenPath = "/"
    spec.OrgID = "default"
})
```

TITLE: Building Gateway and Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build both the Tyk Gateway and the custom plugin using the correct build flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/plugins/go-development-flow.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd tyk-release-5.3.6 && go build -tags=goplugin -trimpath . && cd -
cd plugins           && go build -trimpath -buildmode=plugin . && cd -
```

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type CoProcessObject struct {
	HookType string
	Request  CoProcessMiniRequestObject
	Session  SessionState
	Metadata map[string]string
	Spec     map[string]string
}
```

TITLE: Task Commands for Tyk Development
DESCRIPTION: Commands using Task runner to setup the project and run integration tests. Requires Task to be installed following the taskfile.dev instructions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

TITLE: Complete Middleware Configuration in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Full JSON configuration example showing all available middleware hooks and their configuration options
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"custom_middleware": {
  "pre": [
      {
          "name": "MyPreMiddleware",  
          "require_session": false
      },
      {
          "name": "AnotherPreMiddleware",
          "require_session": false
      }
  ],
  "post": [
    {
      "name": "MyPostMiddleware",
      "require_session": false
    }
  ],
  "post_key_auth": [
    {
      "name": "MyPostKeyAuthMiddleware",
      "require_session": true
    }
  ],
  "auth_check": {
    "name": "MyAuthCheck"
  },
  "driver": "python"
}
```

TITLE: Defining Test Cases in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define test cases using the TestCase structure from the test package. It includes various HTTP requests with different methods, paths, headers, and expected response codes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
ts.Run(t, []test.TestCase{
        // Create base auth based key
        {Method: "POST", Path: "/tyk/keys/defaultuser", Data: session, AdminAuth: true, Code: 200},
        {Method: "GET", Path: "/", Code: 401, BodyMatch: `Authorization field missing`},
        {Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: validPassword, Code: 200},
        {Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: wrongPassword, Code: 401},
        {Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: wrongFormat, Code: 400, BodyMatch: `Attempted access with malformed header, values not in basic auth format`},
        {Method: "GET", Path: "/", Headers: malformed, Code: 400, BodyMatch: `Attempted access with malformed header, auth data not encoded correctly`},
    }...)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: TestCase Structure Definition in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This code defines the TestCase structure used for specifying test cases in the Tyk API Gateway. It includes fields for HTTP request details, response assertions, and test execution options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type TestCase struct {
	Method, Path    string            `json:",omitempty"`
	Domain          string            `json:",omitempty"`
	Proto           string            `json:",omitempty"`
	Code            int               `json:",omitempty"`
	Data            interface{}       `json:",omitempty"`
	Headers         map[string]string `json:",omitempty"`
	PathParams      map[string]string `json:",omitempty"`
	Cookies         []*http.Cookie    `json:",omitempty"`
	Delay           time.Duration     `json:",omitempty"`
	BodyMatch       string            `json:",omitempty"`
	BodyMatchFunc   func([]byte) bool `json:",omitempty"`
	BodyNotMatch    string            `json:",omitempty"`
	HeadersMatch    map[string]string `json:",omitempty"`
	HeadersNotMatch map[string]string `json:",omitempty"`
	JSONMatch       map[string]string `json:",omitempty"`
	ErrorMatch      string            `json:",omitempty"`
	BeforeFn        func()            `json:"-"`
	Client          *http.Client      `json:"-"`

	AdminAuth      bool `json:",omitempty"`
	ControlRequest bool `json:",omitempty"`
}
```

TITLE: Implementing ExtractTo Method for OAS Struct in Go
DESCRIPTION: Pattern for implementing the ExtractTo method in OAS structs. This method extracts the contents of an OAS API definition into a classic API definition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/dev/apidef-oas.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
if u.RateLimit == nil {
	u.RateLimit = &RateLimit{}
	defer func() {
		u.RateLimit = nil
	}()
}

u.RateLimit.ExtractTo(api)
```

TITLE: Changing Config Variables in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to update configuration variables in the Tyk API Gateway. It demonstrates obtaining the current config, modifying it, setting the new config, and performing a reload if necessary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
   ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
   defer ts.Close()
    
   // Obtains current config
   currentConfig := ts.Gw.GetConfig()
   // perform changes
   currentConfig..HTTPProfile = true
   // set new config
   ts.Gw.SetConfig(currentConfig)
   // in some cases will be needed a reload
   ts.Gw.DoReload()
```

TITLE: Configuring Event Handlers in API Definition

LANGUAGE: json

```
"event_handlers": {
  "events": {
    "AuthFailure": [
      {
        "handler_name": "cp_dynamic_handler",
        "handler_meta": {
          "name": "my_handler"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

TITLE: Defining gRPC Dispatcher Service for Tyk Coprocess
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the gRPC service for the Tyk Coprocess dispatcher. It includes methods for dispatching objects and events.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/grpc/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: protobuf
CODE:
```
service Dispatcher {
  rpc Dispatch (Object) returns (Object) {}
  rpc DispatchEvent (Event) returns (EventReply) {}
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Python Event Handler
DESCRIPTION: Python implementation of an event handler for processing authentication failures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/python/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from tyk.decorators import Event

@Event
def my_handler(event, spec):
    print("-- my_handler:")
    print(" Event:", event)
    print(" Spec:", spec)
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:

```
cd coprocess/python
./cythonize gateway
```

TITLE: Running Tyk Gateway Tests
DESCRIPTION: Command to run all tests for Tyk Gateway. Requires Redis to be running on the local machine with default port settings. For writing custom tests, refer to the provided testing guide.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Mocking Dashboard in Go for Tyk API Gateway
DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to mock the dashboard for testing purposes in the Tyk API Gateway. It sets up a test server to handle dashboard API requests and configures the gateway to use this mock dashboard.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
dashboard := httptest.NewServer(http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    if r.URL.Path == "/system/apis" {
        w.Write([]byte(`{"Status": "OK", "Nonce": "1", "Message": [{"api_definition": {}}]}`))
    } else {
        t.Fatal("Unknown dashboard API request", r)
    }
}))

conf := func(confi *config.Config) {
		confi.Global.UseDBAppConfigs = true
        confi.Global.AllowInsecureConfigs = true
        confi.Global.DBAppConfOptions.ConnectionString = dashboard.URL
}

ts := gateway.StartTest(conf)
defer ts.Close()
```

TITLE: Defining HTTP Test Runner Structure in Go
DESCRIPTION: Defines the structure of the HTTP test runner with customizable behavior through function variables. The main struct contains Do, Assert, and RequestBuilder function fields that can be overridden to customize testing behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
type HTTPTestRunner struct {
	Do             func(*http.Request, *TestCase) (*http.Response, error)
	Assert         func(*http.Response, *TestCase) error
	RequestBuilder func(*TestCase) (*http.Request, error)
}
func (r HTTPTestRunner) Run(t testing.TB, testCases ...TestCase) {
...
}
```

TITLE: Preparing Go Workspace for Plugin Development
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to set up a Go workspace for plugin development, including creating necessary files and fetching sample plugin code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/plugins/go-development-flow.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir -p plugins
cd plugins
go mod init testplugin
go mod edit -go $(go mod edit -json go.mod | jq -r .Go)
wget -q https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TykTechnologies/custom-go-plugin/refs/heads/master/go/src/CustomGoPlugin.go
cd -
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HTTP Test Runner for Server Testing
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the HTTPTestRunner for testing against a live server. Sets a baseURL and overrides the Do and RequestBuilder functions to make actual HTTP requests to a server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
import "github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/test"

...
baseURL := "http://example.com"
runner := test.HTTPTestRunner{
    Do: func(r *http.Request, tc *TestCase) (*http.Response, error) {
      return tc.Client.Do(r)  
    }
    RequestBuilder: func(tc *TestCase) (*http.Request, error) {
        tc.BaseURL = baseURL
        return NewRequest(tc)
    },
}
runner.Run(t, testCases...)
...
```

TITLE: Building Plugin with Docker
DESCRIPTION: Example command for building a Tyk plugin using the plugin compiler Docker image. This command builds a plugin for Tyk Gateway v3.0.4 and outputs a .so file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/ci/images/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v `pwd`:/plugin-source tykio/tyk-plugin-compiler:v3.0.4 testplugin.so
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Storage API in Python Middleware
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the Tyk storage API to interact with Redis from Python middleware.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/python/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from tyk.decorators import *
from gateway import TykGateway as tyk

@Pre
def SetKeyOnRequest(request, session, spec):
    tyk.store_data( "my_key", "expiring_soon", 15 )
    val = tyk.get_data("cool_key")
    return request, session
```

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for OAuth2.0 Introspection
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables configuration for the OAuth2.0 introspection plugin, specifying the endpoint URL and authorization header value to be used in the introspection request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/ci/tests/plugin-compiler/testdata/test-plugin/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
OAUTH2_INTROSPECT_ENDPOINT="https://SOME_AUTHORIZATION_SERVER_INTROSPECTION_ENDPOINT"
OAUTH2_INTROSPECT_AUTHORIZATION="AUTHORIZATION_HEADER_VALUE"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Auth Configuration Example for OAuth2.0 Introspection
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the plugin with Basic Authentication, showing the environment variable setup and the resulting HTTP request format used for token introspection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/ci/tests/plugin-compiler/testdata/test-plugin/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
OAUTH2_INTROSPECT_AUTHORIZATION="Bearer 23410913-abewfq.123483"

     POST /introspect HTTP/1.1
     Host: server.example.com
     Accept: application/json
     Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
     Authorization: Basic czZCaGRSa3F0MzpnWDFmQmF0M2JW

     token=2YotnFZFEjr1zCsicMWpAA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating API Version in Tyk Tests
DESCRIPTION: Example of updating an API version in Tyk tests. This shows how to modify specific version details of an API specification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
defer ts.Close()

ts.Gw.updateAPIVersion(spec, "v1", func(v *apidef.VersionInfo) {
    v.Paths.BlackList = []string{"/blacklist/literal", "/blacklist/{id}/test"}
    v.UseExtendedPaths = false
})
```

TITLE: Configuring API Definition JSON for OAuth2.0 Introspection Plugin
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for enabling the OAuth2.0 Introspection plugin in a Tyk API definition. It sets up the plugin in the post_key_auth hook to validate tokens after authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/ci/tests/plugin-compiler/testdata/test-plugin/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "custom_middleware": {
    "post_key_auth": [{
      "name": "OAuth2Introspect",
      "path": "SOMEDIRECTORY/oauth2_introspection/oauth2_introspection.so"
    }],
  "driver": "goplugin",
}
```

TITLE: Handling VersionData in ExtractTo Method for OAS Struct in Go
DESCRIPTION: Example of using helper functions to handle VersionData in the ExtractTo method of OAS structs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/dev/apidef-oas.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func (g *GlobalRequestSizeLimit) ExtractTo(api *apidef.APIDefinition) {
	mainVersion := requireMainVersion(api)
	defer func() {
		updateMainVersion(api, mainVersion)
	}()

	// manipulate the Main VersionInfo here
}
```

TITLE: Exporting Gateway API Functions in Go
DESCRIPTION: Example of exporting Go functions for C interoperability using cgo
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
//export TykTriggerEvent
func TykTriggerEvent( CEventName *C.char, CPayload *C.char ) {
  eventName := C.GoString(CEventName)
  payload := C.GoString(CPayload)

  FireSystemEvent(tykcommon.TykEvent(eventName), EventMetaDefault{
    Message: payload,
  })
}
```

TITLE: Implementing Python FFI Bridge
DESCRIPTION: Example of Python/Cython code for calling exported C functions
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
cdef extern:
  void TykTriggerEvent(char* event_name, char* payload);

def call():
  event_name = 'my event'.encode('utf-8')
  payload = 'my payload'.encode('utf-8')
  TykTriggerEvent( event_name, payload )
```

TITLE: OAS Fixture Configuration Example
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration example showing how to set up an OAS to Classic API migration test fixture with custom authentication settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/docs/dev/oas-fixtures.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
name: "Plugins"
tests:
  - desc: "From OAS to Classic"
    source: oas
    debug: true
    input:
      x-tyk-api-gateway:
        server:
          authentication:
            custom:
              enabled: true
              functionName: "name"
              path: "/path/to/file.so"
              rawBodyOnly: true
              requireSession: true
```

TITLE: Testing Plugin Image Commands
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands for testing the plugin compiler image, including setting version tag, removing existing plugins, running the compiler, and starting the test environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/ci/images/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

CODE:
```

rm -v testplugin/*.so
docker run --rm -v `pwd`/testplugin:/plugin-source tykio/tyk-plugin-compiler:${tag} testplugin.so
docker-compose -f test.yml up
```

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
if u.RateLimit == nil {
	u.RateLimit = &RateLimit{}
}

u.RateLimit.Fill(api)
if ShouldOmit(u.RateLimit) {
	u.RateLimit = nil
}
```

TITLE: Generating Basic Auth Header in Go
DESCRIPTION: Function to generate a Basic Authentication header by encoding username and password.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func genAuthHeader(username, password string) string {
	toEncode := strings.Join([]string{username, password}, ":")
	encodedPass := base64.StdEncoding.EncodeToString([]byte(toEncode))
	return fmt.Sprintf("Basic %s", encodedPass)
}
```

TITLE: Traditional Go Test for Basic Auth Wrong Password
DESCRIPTION: Example of a traditional Go test function for testing Basic Authentication with a wrong password. This demonstrates the older testing style for comparison.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
func TestBasicAuthWrongPassword(t *testing.T) {
    spec := createSpecTest(t, basicAuthDef)
    session := createBasicAuthSession()
    username := "4321"

    // Basic auth sessions are stored as {org-id}{username}, so we need to append it here when we create the session.
    spec.SessionManager.UpdateSession("default4321", session, 60)

    to_encode := strings.Join([]string{username, "WRONGPASSTEST"}, ":")
    encodedPass := base64.StdEncoding.EncodeToString([]byte(to_encode))

    recorder := httptest.NewRecorder()
    req := testReq(t, "GET", "/", nil)
    req.Header.Set("Authorization", fmt.Sprintf("Basic %s", encodedPass))

    chain := getBasicAuthChain(spec)
    chain.ServeHTTP(recorder, req)

    if recorder.Code == 200 {
        t.Error("Request should have failed and returned non-200 code!: \n", recorder.Code)
    }

    if recorder.Code != 401 {
        t.Error("Request should have returned 401 code!: \n", recorder.Code)
    }

    if recorder.Header().Get("WWW-Authenticate") == "" {
        t.Error("Request should have returned WWW-Authenticate header!: \n")
    }
}
```

TITLE: Updating API Version using JSON in Tyk Tests
DESCRIPTION: Example of updating an API version using JSON unmarshaling in Tyk tests. This demonstrates how to modify API definitions using JSON data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/TESTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
ts := gateway.StartTest(nil)
 defer ts.Close()

 ts.Gw.updateAPIVersion(spec, "v1", func(v *apidef.VersionInfo) {
     json.Unmarshal([]byte(`[
         {
            "path": "/ignored/literal",
            "method_actions": {"GET": {"action": "no_action"}}
        },
        {
            "path": "/ignored/{id}/test",
            "method_actions": {"GET": {"action": "no_action"}}
        }
    ]`), &v.ExtendedPaths.Ignored)
 })
```

TITLE: AMQP Load Generator Usage Help
DESCRIPTION: Command-line help output showing available options for the AMQP load generator script including protocol selection, URL configuration, and queue/exchange settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/tests/streams/scripts/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
$ go run amqp_load_generator.go -h
Usage: amqp_load_generator [options]

AMQP load generator. Publishes messages to a RabbitMQ queue using the specified protocol.

Options:
  -h, --help     Print this message and exit.
      --protocol AMQP protocol version to use. Supported values: amqp_0_9, amqp_1. Default: amqp_0_9.
      --url      RabbitMQ server URL. Default: amqp://guest:guest@localhost:5672/.
      --queue    RabbitMQ queue name. Default: tyk-streams-test-queue.
      --exchange RabbitMQ exchange name, only valid for amqp_0_9 Default: tyk-streams-test-exchange.
```

TITLE: Installing Lua-CJSON Dependency via LuaRocks
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required lua-cjson package using the LuaRocks package manager. This package is essential for JSON processing in Lua-based Tyk middleware.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tyktechnologies/tyk/blob/master/coprocess/lua/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
% luarocks install lua-cjson
```
